title: AB 467
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 12519 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to define a "model rocket" as a toy or educational device weighing up to 1500 grams, propelled by a model rocket motor and meeting specific safety standards. Section 12520 is also amended to define a "model rocket motor" as a rocket propulsion device using commercially manufactured solid propellant. Section 12565 is also amended. Section 12565 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to classify fireworks or toy propellent devices containing pyrotechnic compositions as model rocket motors if they meet the definition of "model rocket" or "model rocket motor" in Section 12519 or 12520. Additionally, Sections 12602, 12632, and 12634 are also amended regarding licensing requirements for the retail sale, manufacture, import, export, or wholesale of model rocket motors. SEC. 6. Section 12634 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to state that a separate license is not required for manufacturing, wholesaling, importing, or exporting agricultural and wildlife fireworks or model rocket motors if the license allows these activities with other fireworks. SEC. 7. Section 12640 is amended to require a valid permit from the State Fire Marshal or local agency before performing certain activities related to dangerous fireworks or safe and sane fireworks. Manufacturing, importing, exporting, possessing, storing, transporting, using, and selling agricultural and wildlife fireworks and model rocket motors is allowed. It is illegal to discharge dangerous fireworks in any location or use special effects. Selling or transferring any class of fireworks without a valid license or permit is prohibited. Seizure of certain fireworks is authorized under specific conditions. Section 12722 of the Health and Safety Code allows for the seizure of various types of fireworks, including those not examined, classified, and registered by the State Fire Marshal, imported fireworks without proper notices, safe and sane fireworks stored or sold in violation of regulations, and safe and sane fireworks sold without proper labeling. Safe and sane fireworks sold at retail without State Fire Marshal label, before or after specified dates, with unprotected fuses, or stored improperly are prohibited. Dangerous fireworks without a permit or stored near flammable liquids are also not allowed. Fireworks prohibited in public areas with flammable liquids, possession after throwing ignited fireworks, model rockets without permit, emergency signaling devices without State Fire Marshal label, and sale of fireworks by violators.
